title: Job Opportunity : Competitions Manager at COSAFA
body_text:
Job Opportunity: Competitions Manager at COSAFA
Job Opportunity: Competitions Manager at COSAFA
Location: Johannesburg, South Africa (Relocation Required)
Opening Date: 1 February 2026
Closing Date: 20 February 2026
About COSAFA
The Council of Southern African Football Associations (COSAFA) is the governing body for football in the Southern African region. COSAFA is committed to promoting football development through world-class tournaments, grassroots initiatives, and strategic partnerships.
Role Overview
COSAFA is seeking a dynamic and experienced Competitions Manager to oversee the planning, organisation, and delivery of all COSAFA tournaments. This includes flagship events such as the COSAFA Cup, Women’s Championship, Youth Championships, Schools Football Championship, and Beach Soccer Championship.
The Competitions Manager will play a pivotal role in ensuring tournaments are executed to the highest standards, in compliance with COSAFA, CAF, and FIFA regulations, while fostering football development across the region.
Key Responsibilities
- Lead the planning and execution of COSAFA tournaments from inception to completion.
- Develop competition formats, schedules, and regulations in line with CAF and FIFA standards.
- Coordinate with host nations, member associations, and stakeholders on logistics and operations.
- Ensure compliance with all competition rules and regulations.
- Oversee match scheduling, team travel, accommodation, and security arrangements.
- Liaise with media and communications teams to promote tournaments effectively.
- Provide post-event reports and recommendations for continuous improvement.
Required Competencies
- Deep knowledge of football operations and competition management.
- Strong project management and leadership skills.
- Excellent organisational and problem-solving abilities.
- High-level communication and networking skills.
- Ability to manage time effectively and deliver under pressure.
Qualifications & Experience
- Minimum: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent.
- Advantageous: Master’s Degree or equivalent, plus certifications in Sports/Event Management (e.g., FIFA Masters).
- Experience in football or sports event management.
- Proven track record in managing large-scale competitions.
Remuneration
- Total Guaranteed Package (TGP): The successful candidate will receive a competitive monthly salary based on knowledge and experience.
- Provision for Medical Aid: The company facilitates access to group medical aid benefits. A defined employer contribution, linked to a specific medical aid plan option. The employee may choose to belong to this scheme and contribute the remaining portion, or may elect to make alternative arrangements, in which case the contribution will be structured as part of the total package.
- Other Benefits: Remuneration is complemented by the company’s standard benefits, which may include, subject to policy:
* Provident/Pension Fund contributions.
* Group Life Assurance cover.
* Annual performance-based bonus (discretionary and subject to company and individual performance).
* Generous leave allocation.
The final package will be structured and discussed in detail at the offer stage.
Why Join COSAFA?
This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to the growth of football in Southern Africa. You will work closely with member associations, CAF, FIFA, and other partners to deliver impactful tournaments that inspire players, fans, and communities.
Application Details
Interested candidates should submit a detailed CV and cover letter to sue@cosafa.com and depexd@cosafa.com
- Opening Date: 1 February 2026
- Closing Date: 20 February 2026
- Location: Johannesburg, South Africa (Relocation required)
